results.title: Claude Jutra: an unfinished story
results.creator_credit: Fox-Fire Films, Production Docu 2, ONF | NFB, Anne Frank, Andre Theberge and Paule Baillargeon
results.brief_description: Claude Jutra (1930-1986) was an innovative Quebecois filmmaker who made some of Canadian cinema’s best known films including “Mon Oncle Antoine”, “A Chairy tale”, “A Tout prende”, “WOW” and “Kamouraska”. Paule Baillargeon; actress, director and friend; contemplates Jutra’s creative genius, his commitment to furthering French-Candian cultural identity, and his frustrated and difficult career. Through interviews with friends (including Bernardo Bertolucci and Saul Rubinek), film excerpts and extensive footage of the filmmaker himself, Jutra emerges as a sensitive, passionate man who gave his life completely to cinema. Faced with the decline of his faculties due to the onset of Alzheimer’s Disease, he took the decision to end his life aged 56. Some French with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Fox-Fire Films, Production Docu 2, ONF | NFB, Anne Frank, Andre Theberge and Paule Baillargeon

results.title: Classroom organisation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Lewis and Drake Educational Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The point is made that there is no one way to organise a lesson and the teacher in this tape doesn’t always organise her work in the way shown. However viewers will see the basis of her planning and the thought which has gone into her planning of the mathematics class

results.title: Classroom crisis: dealing with violence in school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Johnson, Dave Bell Associates and Dave Bell
results.brief_description: Violence presents a real danger for teachers. Dr. Fred Feitler of Youngstown State University has developed strategies for dealing with student fights, physical assaults, disciplinary confrontations and other crisis situations.

results.title: Classifying plants and animals
results.brief_description: A short history of classification, introducing Linnaeus’ system of binomial nomenclature. Animation is used to show how Linnaeus’ system works. The classification of the common dog is traced.

results.title: Classifying by computer
results.brief_description: Explains how statistical treatment of survey data and construction of a classification can be done by a suitably programmed computer. Takes us step by step thorugh the process from collection of data, through programming, to final results.

results.title: Classification (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Piaget’s Developmental Theory”.
Based on the work of Jean Piaget. Shows how a child’s ability to classify in a number of different situations can be used as an index of more general intellectual growth. Demonstrates the “clinical interview” situation used in presenting children with cognitive tasks and gives examples of pre-operational and concrete operational subjects, typical behavioural responses and reasoning.
